meta.name: Pastel Study Companion (Mobile) – High-Level Design DNA
meta.source: Reference screenshot (3 mobile screens: dashboard, quiz, schedule)
meta.purpose: Guide AI to replicate the visual language: soft pastel, rounded, playful, premium-lite.

principles: Use a strict 4px scale; most paddings 12–20px.
Rely on whitespace and surface contrast instead of borders.
Cards stack vertically with gentle separation; avoid crowding.

fontFamilies.primary: var(--font-inter), Inter, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, sans-serif

usage: Headlines are bold and compact; keep to one line when possible.
Body text stays calm; use captions for metadata and chips.
Avoid all caps; prefer sentence case with small-caps accents only in tiny labels.

usageRules: Prefer pastel fills over borders; if a divider is needed, use 1px with 8–12% opacity of ink.
Primary actions: solid brand primary; secondary: tinted surfaces using brand RGB at 10–16%.
Backgrounds can softly shift per section: pink for hero, neutral white for lists.

shadowsAndDepth.layering: Hierarchy via surface contrast, pastel blocks, and subtle gradients.
usage: Use nested surfaces and gentle gradients for depth.

separation: Dividers only when density is high; keep opacity low.

iconography.style: Rounded outline or duotone icons inside circular pastel tokens.

illustration.style: Playful 2.5D mascot/character, flat with soft shading and thick outlines.
illustration.background: Concentric pastel rings or soft gradients behind mascot.
usage: Use illustration as hero focus; keep surrounding UI minimal.
Maintain consistent stroke thickness and rounded corners on shapes.

principles: Keep bar light; no borders; align vertically centered.
Cards are primary layout units; nest pastel tiles for grouping.

StatsSummary.layout: 2-up grid on mobile; number is hero.
principles: Bold numerals, soft containers, minimal chrome.
No borders; focus tint only; keep compact.
Tabs feel like chips, not bars; limited to 3–5 options.
Keep labels short; one primary action per view; use pill shapes.
Use for filters/subjects; allow multiple chips in a wrap row.
Rows feel like mini-cards; no hard separators; rely on color grouping.
Center align day; show subtle ring for today/selected.

do: Lead with bold numerals and clear hierarchy; keep chrome minimal.
Use pastel surfaces to group and sequence content.
Maintain generous padding and large hit areas (>=40px height).
Use pill shapes for inputs, tabs, and actions.
Keep typography short and high-weight for headings.
dont: Avoid hard borders and heavy shadows.
Avoid dense text blocks; prefer concise labels.
Avoid sharp corners; keep everything rounded.
accessibility: Ensure text contrast meets WCAG on pastel backgrounds (prefer ink colors).
Provide focus-visible states via tint/outline, not glow.
Icon buttons need aria-label and at least 44px touch target.

cssVariables: Use existing --color-primary, --color-primary-rgb; derive tints with rgba().
Map pastels to CSS vars where possible to keep themeable.
Set border-radius tokens in SCSS/TS constants for reuse.
layoutPatterns: Wrap pages in a soft app background; place major sections in white cards.
Use 2-up stat grid for small metrics; single-column for lists/schedule.
Prefer chip rails (PillTabs) for filtering rather than dropdowns.
interaction: Press feedback: scale(0.98) + slight tint change; no shadow on press.
For scroll areas, keep inset padding so pills and chips do not touch edges.
